sections.heading: Purpose of this screen
body: The Reminders screen is where you manage recurring care schedules for your plants.
A reminder defines what should be done (task type), how often it repeats (interval), and which plant it belongs to. Based on that, Flovers generates tasks automatically over time.

sections.heading: Two views: Reminder list and Calendar
body: This screen has two modes: a list of reminders and a calendar view.
You can switch between them by swiping left/right or by using the Floating Action Button (FAB) option that changes the view.
Both views show the same data, just presented differently depending on whether you want a quick list or a schedule overview.

sections.heading: Reminder list view
body: In the list view, each tile represents a single reminder created by the user.
The tile shows the task type (icon and name), the plant name, the location (if assigned), how often it repeats, and when it is due next.
This view is the fastest way to review all recurring rules currently active in your account.

sections.heading: Reminder tile actions (Edit / Delete)
body: Each reminder tile provides two actions: Edit and Delete.
Edit lets you change reminder parameters such as interval, task type, associated plant, and other reminder settings (depending on the reminder type).
Delete removes the reminder permanently. In practice, this also means tasks will no longer be generated from that reminder going forward.

sections.heading: Calendar view
body: In calendar view, reminders are visualized as scheduled items on calendar days.
To see details for a specific date, tap a day in the calendar; scheduled items for that day will appear below the calendar.
The calendar uses visual markers to indicate which task types appear on a given day, helping you see routine distribution at a glance.

sections.heading: FAB actions
body: The Floating Action Button (FAB) provides quick actions for managing reminders and navigation between the two views.
Available actions include: Add reminder, change view (List/Calendar), Sort, and Filter.
Sorting can be applied by due date, plant name, or location.
Filtering can be applied by plant name, location, task type, and due date range.

sections.heading: How reminders generate tasks (general logic)
body: A reminder is a recurring rule (for example: Water every 7 days).
Flovers generates tasks from reminders and presents them on the Home screen as actionable items.
When a task is completed, the next one is scheduled according to the reminder interval (so the routine continues automatically).

sections.heading: Notes and practical tips
body: Reminders help you stay consistent, but they do not guarantee plant health—real conditions may require adjusting intervals.
If you change your environment (season, light, substrate, pot size), consider updating reminders to match the new conditions.
If you want to manage already completed tasks and notes, use the Task History screen (documented separately).
